meanings.definition: An instrument for measuring the rate of evaporation of water into the atmosphere.
meanings.sent1: The atmometer showed how quickly water was disappearing into the air.
meanings.sent2: Scientists use the atmometer to track how fast water evaporates.
meanings.sent3: The atmometer seemed to be in a race with the sun to see who could dry up the water first.
meanings.sent4: Her eyes were like an atmometer, constantly measuring the tears she shed.
meanings.sent5: The atmometer hummed softly as it diligently recorded the evaporation rate.

meanings.definition: A device used to measure the amount of water vapor in the air.
meanings.sent1: The atmometer displayed the exact level of water vapor in the room.
meanings.sent2: Meteorologists rely on the atmometer to gauge humidity levels.
meanings.sent3: The atmometer giggled when it detected a sudden increase in water vapor.
meanings.sent4: His mind was like an atmometer, always sensing the emotional atmosphere around him.
meanings.sent5: The atmometer beeped excitedly as it registered a rise in water vapor content.
